abstract: The proposed new drug would combine Merck’s drug Zetia, which lowers “bad” cholesterol, with the generic version of Lipitor, the statin made by Pfizer.
snippet: The proposed new drug would combine Merck’s drug Zetia, which lowers “bad” cholesterol, with the generic version of Lipitor, the statin made by Pfizer.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration on Monday rejected an application by Merck to combine a cholesterol-fighting pill with the generic version of Lipitor.

headline.main: In Rejection, F.D.A. Wants More Data From Merck
headline.print_headline: In Rejection, F.D.A Wants More Data From Merck
